meta.content: Digg, pictures, technology, breaking news, entertainment, politics, headline news, celebrity news, offbeat, world business, sports, funny videos

meta.content: The most interesting and talked about stories, videos and pictures on the web. Breaking news on Technology, Politics, Entertainment, and more!

meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: How Many People Have Been Killed By Guns Since Newtown?

div.div: Slate partners with @GunDeaths for an interactive, crowdsourced tally of the toll firearms have taken since Dec. 14.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UMgcQS&via=Digg&text=How Many People Have Been Killed By Guns Since Newtown?

div.a: The Financial Evolution Of The Christmas Present

div.div: Indulge in a bit of festive nostalgia and take a look at this infographic to compare the cost and style of Christmas presents over the decades.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SINfae&via=Digg&text=The Financial Evolution Of The Christmas Present

div.a: Instagram Terms Of Service Don't Have To Be So Complicated

div.div: If the executives really wanted to, they could tell their lawyers to write a plain Terms of Service. And then we'd understand whether we are signing our online lives away. There is no reason for the innovation to stop once the lawyers show up.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V9jQHc&via=Digg&text=Instagram Terms Of Service Don't Have To Be So Complicated

div.a: How Do TSA Employees Feel About Working For A Despised Agency?

div.div: The higher-ups are aware of people’s general disdain for TSA, and seem to handle all the TSA-hatred defensively, reactively; wrapped in a constant state of damage control. The screeners, however, react in one of two ways.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WAQP9V&via=Digg&text=How Do TSA Employees Feel About Working For A Despised Agency?

div.a: What Is Your College Degree's True Value?

div.div: How much is a college diploma actually worth? The perennial question asked by every former English, philosophy, and art history major now has an answer in some states.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VdqHex&via=Digg&text=What Is Your College Degree's True Value?

div.a: Adam Lanza Tried To Destroy His Hard Drive. Here’s How We Can Still Follow His Electronic Trail.

div.div: Last week, Adam Lanza tried to destroy the hard drive on his computer. But whatever he was trying to hide might still be recoverable—and other options are available when it comes to uncovering his digital trail.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WusnmT&via=Digg&text=Adam Lanza Tried To Destroy His Hard Drive. Here’s How We Can Still Follow His Electronic Trail.

div.a: How To Carve A Christmas Turkey Like A Physicist

div.div: Planning to have roast turkey at Christmas? You’ll be glad to hear that physicists have revealed exactly how to carve it – using jelly and a fishing line.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12EzBbi&via=Digg&text=How To Carve A Christmas Turkey Like A Physicist

div.a: The Day I Almost Shot My Father

div.div: When I was 8 or 9 years old, I almost shot my father. When I say almost, I mean I loaded two 12-gauge shotgun shells into a side-by-side shotgun, snapped it closed, and walked down the hallway to his study, where he was working.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UVPG7h&via=Digg&text=The Day I Almost Shot My Father

div.div: Facebook has just announced a new app called Poke, which has a Snapchat-like feature that allows users to send private messages that expire after 1, 3, 5 or 10 seconds.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XVCqk6&via=Digg&text=Facebook's Poke: The New Snapchat?

div.a: The NRA Vs. Really Old Video Games

div.div: Perhaps the most talked-about moment from the National Rifle Association's already eventful press conference came when NRA Executive Vice President Wayne LaPierre called out the "corrupting shadow industry" of video games — then cited 10 year old titles like they were good evidence for things like school shootings.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UiodA6&via=Digg&text=The NRA Vs. Really Old Video Games

div.a: How Did Siri Get Its Name?

div.div: Adam Cheyer, co-founder of Siri, explains.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VaG9wc&via=Digg&text=How Did Siri Get Its Name?

div.a: The First Moon Walk Practices Looked Pretty Ridiculous

div.div: In 1963 no one had walked the moon, which meant that nobody knew what to expect when they go there. So astronauts had go through a battery of creative, zero-gravity training on Earth, much of which looked terrifically silly. Fortunately, someone was taking pictures.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RJ63rU&via=Digg&text=The First Moon Walk Practices Looked Pretty Ridiculous

div.a: Why The Instagram Debacle Just Taught Every Tech Company To Be Shadier Than Ever

div.div: The newly-reinstated terms of service clause is objectively worse for users than the new one, and it's worded far more vaguely — the language feels familiar and comforting, but you're giving up more rights to your photos.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VUJknZ&via=Digg&text=Why The Instagram Debacle Just Taught Every Tech Company To Be Shadier Than Ever

div.div: YOU MIGHT EVEN SAY IT BLOWS

div.a: The Decline Of Christmas Pop Music—And Why Indie Rock Can Save It

div.div: Each year, we feast on the same tropes—the Macy’s parade, the ensemble romantic comedies, the Christmas Story reruns—while pop acts reliably crank out versions of proven holiday standards. But where are all the new Christmas hits?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WyKiN9&via=Digg&text=The Decline Of Christmas Pop Music—And Why Indie Rock Can Save It

div.div: Are we sure the world didn't really end?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WuRqGn&via=Digg&text=Gangnam Style Makes YouTube History

div.a: The Instagram Saga Described In Comic Form

div.div: Is all the talk about Instagram's TOS changes simply too complicated for you? Here they are presented in a simpler format.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ve1JLV&via=Digg&text=The Instagram Saga Described In Comic Form

div.div: One of the last projects Steve Jobs worked on before his passing was an 80-meter yacht that was co-designed by renowned designer Philippe Starck. Now it's been impounded.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wuxrrr&via=Digg&text=Steve Jobs’ Yacht Impounded

div.a: A $5 Lamp Powered Solely By Gravity

div.div: GravityLight harnesses the power of gravity to provide a realistic alternative to kerosene lamps. The $5 light requires no fuel or batteries, and it takes only 3 seconds to lift the weight which powers GravityLight, creating 30 minutes of light on its descent.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VSqIoO&via=Digg&text=A $5 Lamp Powered Solely By Gravity

div.a: Facebook’s New Privacy Settings Are Here: This Is What You Need To Do Right Now

div.div: We saw a preview earlier this month, but now Facebook's simplified, slimmed down privacy tools should be arriving on your profile. Any minute. Take control and untag those gross pictures you didn't even know existed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V9HmDV&via=Digg&text=Facebook’s New Privacy Settings Are Here: This Is What You Need To Do Right Now

div.div: OR, YOU KNOW, TO KEEP ON IGNORING

div.a: 30 Global Crises To Watch For In 2013

div.div: There is no shortage of potential crises that the Obama administration should consider. Even while the president attempts to address his domestic priorities, he cannot ignore warning signs abroad for such contingencies.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VVWEJh&via=Digg&text=30 Global Crises To Watch For In 2013

div.div: FROM WET AND ANGRY TO SOFT AND CUDDLY

div.a: The History Of The Teddy Bear

div.div: The teddy bear is an American original: Its story begins with a holiday vacation taken by President Theodore Roosevelt.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T5zmpa&via=Digg&text=The History Of The Teddy Bear

div.a: Guy Fieri Got An Honorary Doctorate From UNLV

div.div: Guy Fieri has added another feather to his spiky, bleached cap: The other day at the fall commencement of his alma mater UNLV, Fieri was given an honorary doctorate.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WuwYpe&via=Digg&text=Guy Fieri Got An Honorary Doctorate From UNLV

div.div: Jon Hamm, Beyonce, Will Ferrell and many other celebrities are demanding a plan to end gun violence.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZoMR6c&via=Digg&text=Celebs Unite Against Gun Violence

div.a: How Does NASA Drive Mars Rover Curiosity?

div.div: How exactly do you drive the one-ton Mars rover Curiosity, when the driver is, on average, 150 million miles away? With a one-way time delay of around 13 minutes, it certainly isn’t a matter of sitting down in front of a monitor and waggling a joystick.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wue8hQ&via=Digg&text=How Does NASA Drive Mars Rover Curiosity?

div.a: Piranha Crowned Biting King Of Fish World

div.div: The muscle used to close the fishes' jaws can be up to two percent of the fishes' weight. Imagine a 200-pound man with a pound of beef in each cheek to get the idea of how much muscle that is.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tcxc4J&via=Digg&text=Piranha Crowned Biting King Of Fish World

div.a: Ad From 1890, When Parents Wanted Fat Kids

div.div: This fattening syrup outsold Coca-Cola in 1890, by promising that you and your loved ones could be "fat as pigs."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T5l5IS&via=Digg&text=Ad From 1890, When Parents Wanted Fat Kids

div.a: Will We Ever Be Crazy Enough To Travel To The Stars?

div.div: These days it’s easy to outline why we’ll never go. Stars are too far away; we don’t have the money. The reasons why we might go anyway are less obvious—but they’re getting stronger.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RzLDBl&via=Digg&text=Will We Ever Be Crazy Enough To Travel To The Stars?

div.a: Hubble Wishes Happy Holidays With Awe-Inspiring Nebula Image

div.div: No, this image is not one of the Mayan apocalypse. NASA has a tradition of releasing spectacular Hubble images in time for the winter holidays, such as a 2011 photo of a space “snow angel,” and 2012 was no different.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TaYAyX&via=Digg&text=Hubble Wishes Happy Holidays With Awe-Inspiring Nebula Image

div.a: North Korea Says It Has Detained An American Citizen

div.div: North Korea said on Friday that it had detained an American citizen on charges of committing “hostile acts against the republic,” a crime punishable by years in prison in the isolated country.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R8DGSv&via=Digg&text=North Korea Says It Has Detained An American Citizen

div.a: Jerry Seinfeld, Billy Crystal And Jimmy Fallon Perform 'Who's On First?'

div.div: Fallon, Crystal, and Seinfeld revisit Abbott & Costello's classic "Who's On First?" routine, where we finally get to meet the team's first-baseman "Who," second-baseman "What," and third-baseman "I Don't Know."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UV1QgA&via=Digg&text=Jerry Seinfeld, Billy Crystal And Jimmy Fallon Perform 'Who's On First?'
